condition.description:
Osteoporosis makes your bones weak and more likely to break. Anyone can develop osteoporosis, but it is common in older women. As many as half of all women and a quarter of men older than 50 will break a bone due to osteoporosis.

Risk factors include

  • Getting older
  • Being small and thin
  • Having a family history of osteoporosis
  • Taking certain medicines
  • Being a white or Asian woman
  • Having osteopenia, which is low bone density

Osteoporosis is a silent disease. You might not know you have it until you break a bone. A bone mineral density test is the best way to check your bone health. To keep bones strong, eat a diet rich in calcium and vitamin D, exercise and do not smoke. If needed, medicines can also help.

NIH: National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases
condition.name: Osteoporosis

carousel_items: If you're taking the fast release medication, take it first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 30 minutes after you've taken the fast release medication.
If you're taking the extended release medication, take it after your first meal of the day with at least a half cup of water.
Stay sitting or standing and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
If you forget to take your dose, skip it and take it the following morning.
Some of these medications are only taken once or twice a month, others are taken once a week and others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

basics.benefits_moa: Actonel is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Actonel is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but how you have to take it can be a hassle.
downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Actonel.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Actonel have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: You should be sitting or lying down when you inject Forteo since it can make you dizzy.
You should inject Forteo under the skin in either your thigh or stomach.
Make sure the liquid in the vial of Forteo is clear and colorless before you inject it. Don't use it if it looks cloudy, colored, or if you see particles inside.

basics.benefits_moa: Forteo works by stimulating cells that build up and strengthen your bones.
basics.bottom_line: Forteo is a good second-choice medication to treat bone loss, but it's only available as an injectable.
downsides: Only available as a brand medication, so it can be expensive.
You have to inject this every day, so it may not be a good option if you don't like needles.
Shouldn't take this longer than 18 to 24 months since it can increase the risk of bone cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand medication, so it can be expensive.
You have to inject this every day, so it may not be a good option if you don't like needles.
Shouldn't take this longer than 18 to 24 months since it can increase the risk of bone cancers.

upsides: If you're unable to use bisphosphonates or are still having fractures despite being on other medications, Forteo can be a good alternative.
You can start using Forteo as soon as you stop using bisphosphonates.

carousel_items_processed.orig: You should be sitting or lying down when you inject Forteo since it can make you dizzy.
You should inject Forteo under the skin in either your thigh or stomach.
Make sure the liquid in the vial of Forteo is clear and colorless before you inject it. Don't use it if it looks cloudy, colored, or if you see particles inside.

risks_warnings.title: Malignant tumor of the bone
risks_warnings.description: In studies with animals, Forteo caused an increase in the incidence of osteosarcoma (a malignant bone tumor) that was dependent on the medication dose and treatment duration. Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

description_processed.orig: In studies with animals, Forteo caused an increase in the incidence of osteosarcoma (a malignant bone tumor) that was dependent on the medication dose and treatment duration. Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: High calcium blood levels
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

risks_warnings.title: Positional low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

description_processed.orig: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Forteo while you are also taking digoxin, it can affect the blood levels of digoxin and cause toxicity.

carousel_items: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

clock.tip: Works more slowly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Fosamax is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Fosamax is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but taking it can be a hassle.
downsides: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

carousel_items: Remember to get your shot every 6 months. Write it down on your calendar.
If your doctor also told you to take calcium and vitamin D, remember to take them as well. They'll work with Prolia to help protect your bones.
Can cause skin irritation, joint pain, limb pain, and back pain.
Let your doctor know if you start getting more infections.
Let your dentist know that youâ€™re taking Prolia since it can cause problems in the jaw bone after dental procedures.

basics.benefits_moa: Prolia is a monoclonal antibody. It blocks a protein that sends signals to break down your bones, and therefore prevents bone loss.
basics.bottom_line: Prolia is an effective and convenient treatment for osteoporosis if other options havenâ€™t worked or arenâ€™t appropriate for you. Thereâ€™re risks of some rare side effects, so make sure you're following up with your doctor regularly.
downsides: Approved for women only after theyâ€™ve reached menopause. Donâ€™t use this if youâ€™re pregnant or planning to become pregnant.
Can lower blood calcium levels. You might need to take calcium supplements to prevent this.
Not available as a generic.

Can lower blood calcium levels. You might need to take calcium supplements to prevent this.
Not available as a generic.

upsides: Prolia is effective at preventing bone loss, making your bones stronger and lowering your chance of getting a fracture.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: Some people who take Prolia have had unusual thigh fractures. However, itâ€™s unclear if Prolia causes these fractures. Report any unusual hip, thigh, or groin pain to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Some people who take Prolia have had unusual thigh fractures. However, itâ€™s unclear if Prolia causes these fractures. Report any unusual hip, thigh, or groin pain to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Hypersensitivity (allergic) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Prolia has been linked to allergic reactions. Seek medical attention immediately if you start getting throat tightness, swelling of the face, difficulty breathing, hives, or a drop in your blood pressure.

description_processed.orig: Prolia has been linked to allergic reactions. Seek medical attention immediately if you start getting throat tightness, swelling of the face, difficulty breathing, hives, or a drop in your blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium blood levels
risks_warnings.description: Prolia can lower calcium levels in your blood. If you have low calcium levels, your doctor will want to correct this level before you start Prolia. Even if your levels are normal, your doctor will probably tell you to take calcium and vitamin D supplements daily in addition to getting your Prolia shots. Remember to take your supplements regularly, and get blood tests as directed by your doctor to make sure your calcium levels are normal.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that can lower calcium blood levels
History of hypoparathyroidism (low levels of parathyroid hormone)

description_processed.orig: Prolia can lower calcium levels in your blood. If you have low calcium levels, your doctor will want to correct this level before you start Prolia. Even if your levels are normal, your doctor will probably tell you to take calcium and vitamin D supplements daily in addition to getting your Prolia shots. Remember to take your supplements regularly, and get blood tests as directed by your doctor to make sure your calcium levels are normal.

risks_warnings.title: Infection
risks_warnings.description: Patients taking Prolia have reported getting more infections. The type of infections they get can vary and have involved the skin, stomach, urinary tract, ears, gums, or heart. Let your doctor know if you start getting an unusual or severe infection.
risk_factors: Taking medicines that block your immune system (such as transplant medications or steroids)

description_processed.orig: Patients taking Prolia have reported getting more infections. The type of infections they get can vary and have involved the skin, stomach, urinary tract, ears, gums, or heart. Let your doctor know if you start getting an unusual or severe infection.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: Prolia has been associated with severe jaw bone problems. Make sure to take good care of your teeth while you're on Prolia, and let your dentist know that you're taking this medicine. If you start noticing any pain, swelling, or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: Some people who take Prolia start feeling bone, joint, or muscle pain. This could happen anywhere from a day to several months after starting Prolia. Let your doctor know if you notice these symptoms and they're very severe.

carousel_items: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

upsides: Available in generic.
You only have to take this once a year.

You only have to take this once a year.

carousel_items: If you're using the ointment, avoid extended exposure to sunlight or tanning beds.
Make sure to take at least 600 to 1200 mg of calcium per day.
Drink plenty of fluids while you're on this medication.
Call your doctor if you notice a metallic taste in your mouth, muscle or joint pain, headache or sleepiness.
Keep your diet and calcium intake consistent every day.

basics.benefits_moa: Calcitriol is the active form of Vitamin D. It raises Vitamin D levels in your blood. This in turn raises calcium levels in your blood by helping you absorb more calcium from food in your intestine.
basics.bottom_line: Calcitriol is the strongest form of vitamin D available, but it's prescription-only and more expensive than over-the-counter alternatives, and you have to get regular blood tests.
downsides: Your doctor will want to take blood tests to make sure that your body is responding to the medication.
Your doctor may prescribe other medications to make sure other chemicals (phosphate and calcium) in your body remain in balance.
Can interact with antacids containing magnesium.

downsides_processed.orig: Your doctor will want to take blood tests to make sure that your body is responding to the medication.
Your doctor may prescribe other medications to make sure other chemicals (phosphate and calcium) in your body remain in balance.
Can interact with antacids containing magnesium.

upsides: The strongest form of vitamin D that's available to help keep your calcium levels in line in case your parathyroid or kidneys aren't working like they should.
Available in generic.
Available in both intravenous infusion and oral capsule form.

upsides_processed.orig: The strongest form of vitamin D that's available to help keep your calcium levels in line in case your parathyroid or kidneys aren't working like they should.
Available in generic.
Available in both intravenous infusion and oral capsule form.

userStories.tip: I have no parathyroids so this drug saves my life. Regular blood tests assure me that my dosage is correct or needs changing

basics.benefits_moa: Tums is an antacid. It counteracts the effects of stomach acid to relieve heartburn and acid tummy (indigestion).
basics.bottom_line: Tums gives quick relief for heartburn, but don't expect it to last all day.
downsides: Doesn't last very long.
Other antacids like Zantac (H2 blockers) and omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can work better and last longer.
Some chalky aftertaste.

risks_warnings.title: Taking the wrong medication
risks_warnings.description: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

description_processed.orig: There are many different over the counter medications with the brand name Tums.  Each one may contain different active ingredients. Be sure to read the labels carefully to understand what kind of medicine you have and what the correct dose should be.

risks_warnings.title: High blood calcium
risks_warnings.description: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.
risk_factors: Taking high doses of Vitamin D

description_processed.orig: If you have kidney or hyperparathyroid disease Tums can build up in your blood.  This may can cause toxic levels of calcium in your body. This is more likely if you have severe kidney disease (defined as a kidney function blood test called GFR of less than 30ml/min).  If you have severe kidney disease or are on kidney dialysis don't use Tums; a different antacid would be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Tums contains calcium.  Calcium can be an ingredient in some kidney stones.  If you have had kidney stones in the past (especially the calcium-containing kind) be careful using Tums. Use the lowest dose for the shortest time possible or just play it safe and use a different antacid instead.

carousel_items: If you're taking the fast release medication, take it first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 30 minutes after you've taken the fast release medication.
If you're taking the extended release medication, take it after your first meal of the day with at least a half cup of water.
Stay sitting or standing and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
If you forget to take your dose, skip it and take it the following morning.
Some of these medications are only taken once or twice a month, others are taken once a week and others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on Actonel have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

carousel_items: Can be taken as a tablet or as an intravenous infusion.
Take the tablet first thing when you wake up by swallowing the whole pill with a full glass of plain water.
Don't eat or drink anything for 60 minutes after you've taken the tablet.
Stay sitting or standing, and Don't take any other medications, vitamins or supplements for at least 60 minutes after you take the tablet until you've had your first food of the day.
If you have pain with swallowing, around your chest or stomach, or new or worsening heartburn, talk to your doctor.
Take the 150 mg tablet on the same day every month.
If you forget to take the 150mg tablet on your chosen day each month, take it on the next day in the morning.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your jaw, hips or thighs.
Keep taking your calcium and vitamin D.
Some of these medications are only taken once a month, others once a day. Talk to your pharmacist if you're not sure.
Consider adding weight-bearing exercises as part of your exercise routine.

basics.benefits_moa: Boniva is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Boniva is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but how you have to take it can be a hassle. It's also only approved for women, not men.
downsides: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take it first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
You have to remain upright for at least 60 minutes after you take the medication, which can be a problem if you have mobility issues.
Only approved to treat and prevent osteoporosis in women who have gone through menopause.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available in oral tablets that can be given once a month or once a day.
Also available as shot given into your vein every 3 months.

risks_warnings.title: Irritation and ulcers to the stomach and esophagus
risks_warnings.description: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

description_processed.orig: People on the oral version of Boniva have reported irritation to the stomach and esophagus to the point of ulcers. It is very important to remain standing or sitting upright for at least 30 minutes after you take the medication to help stop this from happening, and to take this first thing in the morning when you wake up with a full glass of plain water. Talk to your doctor if this will be a problem for you. Also, talk to your doctor if you notice new pain while swallowing, or pain around the middle of your chest or abdomen while taking this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pain in the bones and muscles
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported severe pain to the bones and muscles. However, this is very rare. Stop taking the medication and talk to your doctor if this happens to you.

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported breakdown of the jaw bone. This is rare. This can happen if you have oral or dental surgery, or if you have poor oral hygiene. If you notice pain, swelling or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away. Also, tell your surgeon that you are taking Boniva.

risks_warnings.title: Leg bone fractures
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

description_processed.orig: People on Boniva have reported bone fractures in the legs without any known cause. This is rare. If you notice a new dull or aching pain in your hips or thighs, talk to your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium in the blood
risks_warnings.description: People on Boniva who have been told they have low calcium in the blood need to be treated for this before they start the medication since it can make the low calcium worse. Your doctor will tell you how to treat this. If you notice muscle spasms or twitching, or numbness and tingling in your fingers, toes or around your mouth, talk to your doctor.

carousel_items: Take 1 tablet daily with or without food about the same time each day. Itâ€™s important to read the information you get with your medicine about how to take Evista.
Your doctor may tell you to take calcium and vitamin D with Evista to prevent osteoporosis (bone thinning and loss), especially if you donâ€™t get enough in your diet.
Regular exercise, cutting back on smoking, and drinking less alcohol can also reduce your risk of bone loss.

basics.benefits_moa: Evista is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM). It acts like estrogen to make your bones stronger and less likely to break, and also protects breast and uterus tissues from other estrogen effects.
basics.bottom_line: Evista is effective at reducing bone loss and lowering the risk of breast cancer in postmenopausal women, but does carry the risk of blood clots.
downsides: Can only take Evista once youâ€™re in menopause. You can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding.
Evista isnâ€™t as effective as tamoxifen at lowering the risk of invasive breast cancer.
Shouldnâ€™t take it with any other forms of estrogen (pills, patches, or injection).
It doesnâ€™t increase bone strength as much as estrogen does and isnâ€™t effective for treating hot flashes.

downsides_processed.orig: Can only take Evista once youâ€™re in menopause. You can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding.
Evista isnâ€™t as effective as tamoxifen at lowering the risk of invasive breast cancer.
Shouldnâ€™t take it with any other forms of estrogen (pills, patches, or injection).
It doesnâ€™t increase bone strength as much as estrogen does and isnâ€™t effective for treating hot flashes.

upsides: Evista doesnâ€™t affect the breast or uterus the same way that estrogen does, so the risk of cancer is much lower.
Taking Evista with calcium and vitamin D improves spine and hip bone health and lowers the risk of fractures.
Lowers total cholesterol and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol (the bad cholesterol).

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1 tablet daily with or without food about the same time each day. Itâ€™s important to read the information you get with your medicine about how to take Evista.
Your doctor may tell you to take calcium and vitamin D with Evista to prevent osteoporosis (bone thinning and loss), especially if you donâ€™t get enough in your diet.
Regular exercise, cutting back on smoking, and drinking less alcohol can also reduce your risk of bone loss.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of stroke
risks_warnings.description: Evista can cause increase the risk of stroke. The risk is greater in women with a history of stroke or TIA, who have heart disease, atrial fibrillation, high blood pressure and who smoke.

description_processed.orig: Evista can cause increase the risk of stroke. The risk is greater in women with a history of stroke or TIA, who have heart disease, atrial fibrillation, high blood pressure and who smoke.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of blood clots
risks_warnings.description: Evista can increase your risk of getting a blood clot. Let your doctor know if you plan to have surgery or a procedure where you'll need extended bed rest. You may need to stop taking Evista during this time. Try to move around if you travel for any length of time (plane, train, car) to prevent getting a blood clot.

description_processed.orig: Evista can increase your risk of getting a blood clot. Let your doctor know if you plan to have surgery or a procedure where you'll need extended bed rest. You may need to stop taking Evista during this time. Try to move around if you travel for any length of time (plane, train, car) to prevent getting a blood clot.

risks_warnings.title: Elevated triglycerides (fats in blood)
risks_warnings.description: Evista can increase triglycerides in women who already have elevated levels. Your doctor will need to monitor your levels before and during your treatment if you decide to take Evista.

description_processed.orig: Evista can increase triglycerides in women who already have elevated levels. Your doctor will need to monitor your levels before and during your treatment if you decide to take Evista.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney or liver function
risks_warnings.description: Evista is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, talk to your doctor because you may need a different dose.

carousel_items: Take Fosamax first thing in the morning with a full glass of water before eating or drinking anything else, including other medicines.
The pill must be swallowed whole.
Stay upright for at least 30 minutes after taking the medicine, and don't eat or drink anything except plain water during that time.
Make sure you take enough calcium and vitamin D to allow this medicine to work.
Can cause an upset stomach, joint pain, back pain, or heartburn.
Stop taking the medicine and let your doctor know if swallowing becomes painful, if you have chest pain, or if any of the side effects worsen.
If you have dental work coming up, get it done before starting this medicine since some people have experienced serious jaw problems while on Fosamax.

clock.tip: Works more slowly when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Fosamax is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Fosamax is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but taking it can be a hassle.
downsides: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You need to take it the first thing in the morning with a full glass of water.
Not good for people who can't sit or stand upright for at least 30 minutes in the morning.
The use of bisphosphonates increases your risk of other types of fractures not related to osteoporosis (called atypical fractures).
Can cause bad heartburn or stomach problems.

upsides: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available as a generic medication.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers your risk of bone fractures.
Available as a generic medication.
Available in two forms: one that can be taken once a day or another that's taken once a week.
Comes as a regular tablet, an oral solution, or effervescent tablets meant to be dissolved in water.

userStories.identifier: On disability due to a neck injury.
userStories.tip: Must take on an empty stomach, first thing in am, with a full glass of water (only water). Must stay upright (either standing or sitting up) for at least a half hour. May cause esophagus irritation or ulcers. May cause reflux.

userStories.identifier: Used to be a very active senior.
userStories.tip: DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG! I was on it for 10 yrs when my right femur broke while taking a simple walk. Xrays showed that my left femur had a hairline facture and would break eventually, so I now have rods in both legs and never without pain.
I wish I had known about the effects on the jaw bone (osteonecrosis)

carousel_items: Given as an intravenous infusion.
Eat normally and drink at least two glasses of liquid before your infusion.
Talk to your doctor if you develop swelling, pain, or a sore in your jaw.
Call your doctor if you develop pain in your hips, thighs or legs.
You can take acetaminophen (Tylenol) to lower fever and chills from the infusion.
If you have to have dental or oral surgery, tell your surgeon that you're taking this medication.
Drink plenty of liquids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Reclast is a bisphosphonate. It slows down osteoclasts, the cells that break down bone. This results in greater bone mass and lowers the possibility of fractures.
basics.bottom_line: Reclast is a first-choice treatment for osteoporosis and is available as a generic, but you have to see a doctor to get each dose.
downsides: You have to go to your doctor's office or an infusion center to get each dose by IV infusion.

risks_warnings.description: Prolia has been linked to allergic reactions. Seek medical attention immediately if you start getting throat tightness, swelling of the face, difficulty breathing, hives, or a drop in your blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Low calcium blood levels
risks_warnings.description: Prolia can lower calcium levels in your blood. If you have low calcium levels, your doctor will want to correct this level before you start Prolia. Even if your levels are normal, your doctor will probably tell you to take calcium and vitamin D supplements daily in addition to getting your Prolia shots. Remember to take your supplements regularly, and get blood tests as directed by your doctor to make sure your calcium levels are normal.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that can lower calcium blood levels
History of hypoparathyroidism (low levels of parathyroid hormone)

risks_warnings.title: Infection
risks_warnings.description: Patients taking Prolia have reported getting more infections. The type of infections they get can vary and have involved the skin, stomach, urinary tract, ears, gums, or heart. Let your doctor know if you start getting an unusual or severe infection.
risk_factors: Taking medicines that block your immune system (such as transplant medications or steroids)

risks_warnings.title: Problems in the jaw bone
risks_warnings.description: Prolia has been associated with severe jaw bone problems. If you start noticing any pain, swelling, or an infection in your jaw, talk to your doctor right away.

carousel_items: You should be sitting or lying down when you inject Forteo since it can make you dizzy.
You should inject Forteo under the skin in either your thigh or stomach.
Make sure the liquid in the vial of Forteo is clear and colorless before you inject it. Don't use it if it looks cloudy, colored, or if you see particles inside.

basics.benefits_moa: Forteo works by stimulating cells that build up and strengthen your bones.
basics.bottom_line: Forteo is a good second-choice medication to treat bone loss, but it's only available as an injectable.
downsides: Only available as a brand medication, so it can be expensive.
You have to inject this every day, so it may not be a good option if you don't like needles.
Shouldn't take this longer than 18 to 24 months since it can increase the risk of bone cancers.

risks_warnings.title: Malignant tumor of the bone
risks_warnings.description: In studies with animals, Forteo caused an increase in the incidence of osteosarcoma (a malignant bone tumor) that was dependent on the medication dose and treatment duration. Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

Forteo shouldn't be prescribed for people with a higher risk of bone cancer, including people with Paget's bone disease and young people with open epiphyses. People are encouraged to enroll in the voluntary patient registry program, which is designed to collect information about people with risk factors who are taking Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: High calcium blood levels
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause high calcium levels in the blood (hypercalcemia). People who have an underlying hypercalcemic disorder, such as primary hyperparathyroidism, shouldn't be treated with Forteo.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

description_processed.orig: Forteo can cause kidney stones, especially if you have high calcium levels in your urine. If kidney stones are suspected, your doctor can measure the amount of calcium in your urine to see if you are at risk. Be careful using this medication if you have a history of kidney stones.

risks_warnings.title: Positional low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

description_processed.orig: Forteo should be first given when you are sitting or laying down since it can cause temporary low blood pressure and dizziness (orthostatic hypotension). If you experience this, it should go away in a few hours. It usually happens for the first few doses and then gets better after that. It shouldn't affect your ability to continue treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Forteo while you are also taking digoxin, it can affect the blood levels of digoxin and cause toxicity.

carousel_items: Starts working in about 2 hours.
Makes you urinate more often, so avoid taking it at bedtime.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness, fatigue, or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.

clock.tip: Works faster on an empty stomach.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic (water pill). It works in the kidneys to make you urinate more, which removes extra water and certain electrolytes. This lowers blood pressure and swelling.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrochlorothiazide is a well-tolerated water pill that's often the first-choice treatment for mild high blood pressure.
downsides: Makes you urinate more often.
Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Makes you urinate more often.
Doesn't work well in people with severe kidney problems.

upsides: Works well to get rid of extra fluids in your body through urination.
A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people. Works especially well for African Americans.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Good option if you have both high blood pressure and heart failure.
Raises calcium levels in the body, so it can be good for people with osteoporosis to slow down bone loss and even help with new bone formation.
Most people have very few side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance
risks_warnings.description: Too much Hydrochlorothiazide can cause excessive urine production, which leads to dehydration and low levels of sodium, potassium or magnesium. The electrolyte imbalance can have negative affects on your muscles or other important organs. Any existing fluid or electrolyte imbalances should be addressed before using Hydrochlorothiazide. Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

Any changes for the medicine should be made by a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: There is a possibility that patients with allergies to other sulfa-containing medicines can experience similar sensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) with Hydrochlorothiazide. Avoid use if prior reaction was severe. Discontinue use if hypersensitivity reactions are observed.

carousel_items: The dose of Provera will be different depending on what youâ€™re using it for, so take it exactly the way your doctor tells you.
Talk to your doctor every few months about using the lowest possible dose of Provera. Since there can be a lot of long-term side effects, take it only as long as you need it.
Can cause headache, weight gain, breast tenderness, or changes in mood.
If you're taking Provera to regulate your period, you'll get withdrawal bleeding 3 to 7 days after stopping Provera.

basics.benefits_moa: Provera contains medroxyprogesterone, a progesterone hormone that works to balance hormone changes in the body. In premenopausal women, it prevents thickening of the uterus lining and regulates your menstrual cycle. It's also added to hormone therapy to protect the uterus from the harmful effects of estrogen.
basics.bottom_line: Provera works well to regulate your menstrual cycle and stop irregular bleeding. It also protects the uterus from estrogen's harmful effects.
downsides: You can't take Provera if you've had a hysterectomy (your uterus removed). You also can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding, have unusual vaginal bleeding, or have a history of blood clots, certain kinds of cancer, stroke, heart attack, liver problems, or bleeding problems.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't take Provera if you've had a hysterectomy (your uterus removed). You also can't take it if you're pregnant or breastfeeding, have unusual vaginal bleeding, or have a history of blood clots, certain kinds of cancer, stroke, heart attack, liver problems, or bleeding problems.

upsides: Provera can be used to treat multiple hormone problems in women.

After menopause, taking estrogen raises your risk of uterine cancer. However, taking progesterone, like in Provera, along with estrogen gives you the positive effects of estrogen, but also prevents it from damaging your uterus.
Women taking an estrogen/progestin combination medications have a lower risk of uterine cancer.

Women taking an estrogen/progestin combination medications have a lower risk of uterine cancer.

drugs.one_liner: Regulates your menstrual cycle and supplements estrogen treatments for menopause.

risks_warnings.title: Breast cancer
risks_warnings.description: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Provera, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of breast cancer

description_processed.orig: It is not completely clear if progestin, like as Provera, increases your risk of breast cancer. There may be a higher risk if you have a history of breast cancer, so make sure to get routine breast exams.

risks_warnings.title: Ovarian cancer
risks_warnings.description: Provera contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

description_processed.orig: Provera contains progestin. It could cause a higher risk of ovarian cancer, especially if you have a family history of it. Your doctor can help you weigh the risks versus the benefits of this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of blood clots and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.
risk_factors: Personal or family history of blood clots

description_processed.orig: Using progestin with or without estrogen can increase your risk of blood clots. Blood clots can cause pain and discomfort from a deep vein thrombosis (a clot in the arm or leg), or serious disability due to a stroke or pulmonary embolism (a clot in the brain or lung). Get medical care right away if you have pain in your legs or arms, bad headaches, trouble breathing, or sudden changes in your speech or vision.

risks_warnings.title: Depression
risks_warnings.description: Provera can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Provera.

description_processed.orig: Provera can cause depression. Let your doctor know if you have a history of, or are taking medicines to treat, depression before starting Provera.

risks_warnings.title: Liver problems
risks_warnings.description: Provera is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Provera if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

description_processed.orig: Provera is metabolized (broken down) by the liver, so if the liver is damaged, the drug can build up in your body. Stop taking Provera if you notice sudden yellowing of your skin or eyes. Don't start taking it if you have abnormal liver blood tests or a history of liver problems.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: You need to be sure you're not pregnant before using Provera since it can harm an unborn baby. Tell your doctor right away if you become pregnant.

description_processed.orig: You need to be sure you're not pregnant before using Provera since it can harm an unborn baby. Tell your doctor right away if you become pregnant.

carousel_items: If you're using the ointment, avoid extended exposure to sunlight or tanning beds.
Make sure to take at least 600 to 1200 mg of calcium per day.
Drink plenty of fluids while you're on this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Calcitriol is the active form of Vitamin D. It raises Vitamin D levels in your blood. This in turn raises calcium levels in your blood by helping you absorb more calcium from food in your intestine.
basics.bottom_line: Calcitriol is the strongest form of vitamin D available, but it's prescription-only and more expensive than over-the-counter alternatives, and you have to get regular blood tests.
downsides: Your doctor will want to take blood tests to make sure that your body is responding to the medication.
Your doctor may prescribe other medications to make sure other chemicals (phosphate and calcium) in your body remain in balance.
Can interact with antacids containing magnesium.
